column4: I just upgraded to Ubuntu 9.10, but I still cant put my desktop to 1440x900 reso to fit my monitor. Itś stuck on 1024x768, and im using the Nvidia drivers
you might try nvidia-xconfig or nvidia-settings
have you activated the nvidia drivers?
yes, I have. and the widget that comes up says CRT-1, and I cant change anything. changing the reso only makes the desktop larger
which driver and what card do you have?
Nvidia driver 185.18.36, gfx card is a GF6800 LE
is there a 173 driver also available?
yeah. I can choose between 173, 185(now actvd), and 96
try the 173 and see what happens.. also in cli type xrandr and see if the resolution that you want comes up.. if it doesn't then you'll have to add the resolution to xrandr to make it work.
1440x900       63.0  <-- that comes up in the last line
I've forgotten.. is that what you want?
I'll have ubottu send you a link .. it might help.
